VIDEO: Z nožem nad turiste v kraju, kamor hodijo tudi Slovenci
Zgodilo se je v Jordaniji.
06 Nov 2019, 15:11 by Ma. M.



REUTERSJeraš je 50 kilometrov oddaljen od Amana. Lani ga je obiskal tudi britanski princ William. FOTO: Muhammad Hamed, Reuters



REUTERSRanjenih je več turistov. FOTO: Muhammad Hamed, Reuters


JERAŠ – Moški je v jordanskem Jerašu z nožem napadel skupino turistov in ranil osem ljudi. Te so na zdravljenje prepeljali v bližnjo bolnišnico, napadalca pa so aretirali.  »Okoli poldneva je moški napadel turiste, turističnega vodiča in varnostnika, ki ga je skušal ustaviti v Jerašu,« so sporočili iz direktorata za javno varnost. Po navedbah predstavnika direktorata Amerja Sartauija so med ranjenimi turisti trije Mehičani in Švicarka.


Ranjenih je več turistov. FOTO: Muhammad Hamed, ReutersREUTERS

Moški je ranil še dva policista, turističnega vodiča in voznika avtobusa. Eden od policistov in mehiški turist sta v kritičnem stanju. Motiv za napad še ni znan, napadalca pa zaslišujejo pristojne oblasti.To ni prvi napad na turiste v Jordaniji. V Karaku je Islamska država decembra 2016 izvedla napad, v katerem je umrlo 10 ljudi, 30 pa jih je bilo ranjenih.

VIDEO: Knife over tourists in a place where Slovenes also go
It happened in Jordan.
06 Nov 2019, 15:11 by Ma. M.



REUTERSYou are 50 kilometers away from Aman. He was also visited last year by British Prince William. PHOTO: Muhammad Hamed, Reuters



REUTERSMore tourists are injured. PHOTO: Muhammad Hamed, Reuters


JERASH - A man in Jordan Jerash with a knife attacked a group of tourists and injured eight people. They were taken to a nearby hospital for treatment and arrested. "Around noon, a man attacked a tourist, a tour guide and a security guard who tried to stop him in Jerash," the Public Security Directorate said. According to a spokesman for Amer Sartaui's directorate, three Mexicans and a Swiss are among the injured tourists.


Several tourists were injured. PHOTO: Muhammad Hamed, ReutersREUTERS

The man injured two other police officers, a tour guide and a bus driver. One of the police officers and a Mexican tourist are in critical condition. The motive for the attack is still unknown, and the attacker is being questioned by the authorities. It is not the first attack on tourists in Jordan. In Karak, an Islamic State carried out an attack in December 2016 in which 10 people died and 30 were injured.
